alert.note: Alert for Coweta (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 03 at 5:27PM EST until January 03 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EST FOR EASTERN CARROLL...DOUGLAS...NORTHWESTERN COWETA AND SOUTHWESTERN FULTON COUNTIES... At 527 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Lake Val-Do-Mar to near Byers Crossroads to Plant Yates, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Douglasville, City of South Fulton, Villa Rica, Palmetto, Whitesburg, Chattahoochee Hills, Lithia Springs, Plant Yates, Byers Crossroads, Hannah, Chapel Hill, Bill Arp, Seaton Lake, Fairplay, Dunaway Gardens, Winston, Lake Val-Do-Mar, Treasure Lake, Campbellton and Roscoe. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for north central, northwestern and west central Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
